Determinants of youth unemployment in Ba.what_specific_intervention(s)_or_policy_: The study suggests targeting work experience programs to the 7–18-month period to accelerate benefits, focusing education support on completion thresholds (the point where completing a level of education yields maximum benefits), and combining education access with work opportunities for lower-income youth. The key mechanisms are increasing relevant work experience, achieving educational milestones, and addressing socioeconomic disparities.

Logistic regression is used to model the probability of unemployment based on various factors. Chi-square tests assess the association between categorical variables (e.g., socioeconomic status and unemployment). ANOVA compares the means of different groups (e.g., unemployment rates across different education levels). Random Forest is a machine learning technique used for prediction and identifying important variables. Determinants of youth unemployment in Ba.based_on_the_empirical_findings,_what_ar: The main conclusions are that postgraduate education significantly reduces unemployment, with a 70.92% reduction in unemployment odds, and each month of work experience decreases unemployment odds by 2.32%. Youths from lower socioeconomic strata face higher unemployment rates. Policy recommendations include focusing work experience programs on the 7–18-month period, supporting education completion, and combining education with work opportunities for lower-income youth. Future research directions involve further exploration of threshold effects and the impact of monthly experience gains.
